intro: Canthium mandrarense, commonly known as the African spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces a milky sap that contains toxic compounds, making it potentially harmful to animals and humans. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories or along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and traditional herbal practices.
